15#ifndef ISC_BASE64_H
16#define ISC_BASE64_H 1
17
18/*! \file isc/base64.h */
19
20#include <isc/lang.h>
21#include <isc/types.h>
22
23ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
24
25/***
26 *** Functions
27 ***/
28
29isc_result_t
30isc_base64_totext(isc_region_t *source, int wordlength,
31 const char *wordbreak, isc_buffer_t *target);
32/*!<
33 * \brief Convert data into base64 encoded text.
34 *
35 * Notes:
36 *\li The base64 encoded text in 'target' will be divided into
37 * words of at most 'wordlength' characters, separated by
38 * the 'wordbreak' string. No parentheses will surround
39 * the text.
40 *
41 * Requires:
42 *\li 'source' is a region containing binary data
43 *\li 'target' is a text buffer containing available space
44 *\li 'wordbreak' points to a null-terminated string of
45 * zero or more whitespace characters
46 *
47 * Ensures:
48 *\li target will contain the base64 encoded version of the data
49 * in source. The 'used' pointer in target will be advanced as
50 * necessary.
51 */
52
53isc_result_t
54isc_base64_decodestring(const char *cstr, isc_buffer_t *target);
55/*!<
56 * \brief Decode a null-terminated base64 string.
57 *
58 * Requires:
59 *\li 'cstr' is non-null.
60 *\li 'target' is a valid buffer.
61 *
62 * Returns:
63 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS -- the entire decoded representation of 'cstring'
64 * fit in 'target'.
65 *\li #ISC_R_BADBASE64 -- 'cstr' is not a valid base64 encoding.
66 *
67 * Other error returns are any possible error code from:
68 *\li isc_lex_create(),
69 *\li isc_lex_openbuffer(),
70 *\li isc_base64_tobuffer().
71 */
72
73isc_result_t
74isc_base64_tobuffer(isc_lex_t *lexer, isc_buffer_t *target, int length);
75/*!<
76 * \brief Convert base64 encoded text from a lexer context into
77 * `target`. If 'length' is non-negative, it is the expected number of
78 * encoded octets to convert.
79 *
80 * If 'length' is -1 then 0 or more encoded octets are expected.
81 * If 'length' is -2 then 1 or more encoded octets are expected.
82 *
83 * Returns:
84 *\li #ISC_R_BADBASE64 -- invalid base64 encoding.
85 *\li #ISC_R_UNEXPECTEDEND: the text does not contain the expected
86 * number of encoded octets.
87 *
88 * Requires:
89 *\li 'lexer' is a valid lexer context
90 *\li 'target' is a buffer containing binary data
91 *\li 'length' is -2, -1, or non-negative
92 *
93 * Ensures:
94 *\li target will contain the data represented by the base64 encoded
95 * string parsed by the lexer. No more than `length` octets will
96 * be read, if `length` is non-negative. The 'used' pointer in
97 * 'target' will be advanced as necessary.
98 */
99
100ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
101
102#endif /* ISC_BASE64_H */
103
